context: A security incident was reported where all file snapshots and shadow copies were deleted via WMI or VSSAdmin, which is a common indicator of ransomware infection. The file `vssblatemp.exe` was launched on the host `vnevado-win11t` with the command line `vssblatemp.exe delete shadows /all`. The Process ID was 1900.
question: Following this incident, numerous file system changes were detected indicating possible ransomware activity. One of the files observed in this context is a PowerShell script. What is the name of this PowerShell script?
solution_steps: All file snapshots and shadow copies were deleted via WMI or VSSAdmin by an account with SID `S-1-5-21-1840191660-8534830288-125585561-1522`, which is common during a ransomware infection.
A possible ransomware activity was detected involving numerous file system changes and appending a known malicious file extension, including the file `get-userprttoken.ps1`.
